newsitem.title: USA: Two dead as Miami building collapses.
newsitem.headline: Two dead as Miami building collapses.

text.p: Two workers were killed and three injured when a disused dog racing club building collapsed during demolition in a Miami suburb on Friday, firefighters said.

The five men were inside the Biscayne Kennel Club building when it collapsed. Rescue crews with search dogs brought out the three survivors and took them to a hospital, where they were reported to be in stable condition.
Workers were still trying to stabilise the structure to remove the bodies.
The building in Miami Shores, north of Miami, had been gutted. Workers planned to finish the demolition on Friday by knocking down the concrete load-bearing beams.
Investigators said they did not know what caused the structure to collapse prematurely, burying the workers under mounds of concrete and twisted metal.
The building, built in 1926, had been vacant since 1995 and was recently sold to Barry University.
